comments:
Hi 

I have several html files with the following line:

<meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=$(display_charset)">

As you can see it does not have a charset value but rather a variable $(display_charset)

This is replaced at runtime on the server. 

If i try to open this in an eclipse editor i get an unsupported encoding error as eclipse tries to guess the encoding. This is not nice but i can correct this by right clicking on properties and change encoding type.

Would be good if it choose the DEFAULT encoding i set for eclipse when it finds an unrecognised encoding.

However the problem is now with CVS compare. If i try to compare two versions of these file files the local one will show up ok (so long as i did the fix above) but the remote file window will be blank. 

The cvs compare internally throws and error about this:

java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException: $(display_charset)

Fix released to HEAD. I was really able to test it though since I can;t load WTP into the latest 3.3 builds die to the version restrictions defined in WTP.
